title: Drawing, Soldier Running :Study for Figure in Left Foreground, "Betrayal of Christ," Rome, S. Maria della Consolazione, Matttei Chapel; Separate Studies of Two Heads, mid-16th century, before 1566
title_raw: Soldier Running :Study for Figure in Left Foreground, "Betrayal of Christ," Rome, S. Maria della Consolazione, Matttei Chapel; Separate Studies of Two Heads
medium: Pen and brown ink, brown wash, black chalk on gray paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Walking toward the right, shown in profile, carrying shield and spear. Descending. In the lower left corner are the heads of a young soldier and that of a bearded man, respectively.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Soldier Running :Study for Figure in Left Foreground, "Betrayal of Christ," Rome, S. Maria della Consolazione, Matttei Chapel; Separate Studies of Two Heads, mid-16th century, before 1566. Pen and brown ink, brown wash, black chalk on gray paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4496
